column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=( ( WN ) )
#Text=Rachel Christian : Senator Delph , you have been labeled as a social conservative .
#Text=Where do you believe you fall on the political spectrum ?
#Text=MD : You know , that 's a good question .
#Text=In my intro ( Wikipedia : Voice Intro Project ) that I read for Wikinews for the project that the professor and I worked on together , I reference myself as a fiscal and social conservative .
#Text=I kind of consider myself a constitutional conservative .
#Text=I consider myself very independent-minded .
#Text=If you look at my last election in 2010 , I won my senate district 59 percent to 41 percent .
#Text=Just two years prior to that , President Barack Obama won the same Senate district 56 percent to 44 percent over John McCain .
#Text=So I think my history has shown an ability to have people who are n't necessarily conservative Republican voters vote for me .
#Text=I try to listen to everybody , anybody in my district who has an issue or concern or wants to talk to me or tell me what they think about anything , always gets my ear .
#Text=And you ca n't do this job and be effective doing this job without being shaped by the views of your constituents , some of whom may disagree with your position on a given issue .
#Text=So I do consider myself a full-spectrum conservative , fiscal and social , but more importantly I consider myself a Constitutional conservative .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Bradie Gray : Recently , political commentator Brian Howey wrote about your senate district .

#Text=Is it fair to say that your district is not socially conservative , that your stand on HJR-3 might not been aligned with your constituents , and that the Democrats see your seat as an opportunity .
#Text=MD : Well you will to talk to the Democrat Party about what they see as an opportunity .
#Text=I ca n't speak for them .
#Text=I will tell you again .
#Text=I survey my constituents every year before we go in session .
#Text=And I knew that the marriage amendment was going to be something that was going to be debated and considered .
#Text=I asked them if they wanted a chance to vote on this through the constitutional amendment process via referendum in November 2014 .
#Text=I sent that survey to all registered voters in Senate District 29 and over 60 percent of the respondents said they wanted a chance to vote in November 2014 .
#Text=Again I did n't ask which way they were going to vote — whether they were going to vote yes or no — but rather did they wanted the chance to vote .
#Text=My position primarily was driven by that piece of information and my desire to try to advocate on behalf of my constituents to bring this whole issue to resolution .
#Text=From a personal standpoint , this issue is very divisive .
#Text=The media is fixated on it .
#Text=Very little else was covered because the media was so fixated on it .
#Text=And to me whether you were for the amendment or against the amendment , there was pretty strong support to being done with it once and for all .
#Text=And I could n't figure out a way to bring final closure to this without going to the referendum process to the public .
#Text=And so I was hoping we could deal with this whole issue in 2014 but others felt differently that were in the leadership .
#Text=And so we are going to be dealing with this issue on into the future .
